sect1.title: BITAND
sect1.para: Return the bitwise and of the the two integer arguments.

itemizedlist.para: <lhs> - Left-hand value. Must be an integer
<rhs> - Right-hand value. Must be an integer

sect2.title: Returns
sect2.para: Returns the bitwise and of two arguments. The type of the result is that of the widest argument.

sect2.title: Example
sect2.programlisting: make “foo 15 ; TODO: Provide a way to specify values in other radixes (radices?) make “bar bitand :foo 7 ; bar == 7 make “foo bitand :bar 8 ; foo == 0
